comment: She is a sweet lady! This class is a lot of work, but you can do it. Ive been used to easy classes, but one is realistic. She is nice and wants the best for you, but doesn't put up with BS. This class will prepare us for the future. She wont let you fail

she cares a lot about her students and is a good professor,but her instruction can be confusing at times and just be prepared for the amount of work this class is. It is difficult but it is worth it and the most realistic engl ed class i have taken

Prof Goodsite is a very nice and caring teacher; however, her instructions are oftentimes confusing and she will often give different answers to different people who have the same questions. The readings she assigns are really helpful and the work she assigns is genuinely interesting and engaging.

If you take this class you'll be fine. It's possible to get an A. She can be really vague with her assignments, but very specific with her grading. That was super annoying. Also, she often graded based on her own thoughts, and not on what I was saying. But by the time she gave grades back it was too late to explain to her that she misunderstood.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: You can tell that she is passionate about what she does and wants you to take the class seriously too. If you miss class she will not only take away from your participation grade, but also the grade of the assignment if one is due that day. There are no tests just reflections and projects. Overall, she is a good prof.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: This professor inspired me to become the teacher I am now. She held high expectations but rewarded strong effort. I am so happy I was able to take her class.

Overall, she was an awesome professor. She really kept our 3 hour class interesting. My only critique is how she handles reflections. She complains when they are "too much summarizing" but that is the purpose of a reflection. To summarize and review what was read/discussed. Overall, if you work hard and attend class you'll be fine.

Seriously, this professor is very confusing. She also waits to the last minute to grade work, meaning the day of when grades are due to the registrars office. Talk about being professional. I should've listened to my classmates that had previously taken her, they told me to avoid her. Maybe your experience will be different. Not again for me.

Good professor but gives a lot of work. She wants the best for her students. If you want an A then you have to work for it, I mean this is college not high school people. She is always willing to help you if you ASK. I have no idea why people are giving her negative feedback. I wasn't going to take her because of the comments but i'm glad I did.

If you are someone who appreciates clear directions DO NOT come here. When she lectures your opinions do not matter. It is her way or the high way. She acts like her wisdom is God's gift to earth. The assignments are not difficult but she does not grade anything. If you want feedback you will get it but do not even concern yourself with a grade.

Professor Goodsite is a tough teacher, there's no doubt about that. She has high expectations, as she should of future educators. The workload is immense at times, but I am thankful for it, as it has prepared me well for TOSS and student teaching. She is incredibly nice and is happy to help you if you ask. I highly recommend her.

Goodsite is an excellent professor who has high expectations for her students. This class requires lots of hard work but the actual class material/content isn't difficult. Goodsite it always willing to help her students and she genuinely cares for students. She is an expert in the field and you'll learn a ton from her! But be prepared to work!

-Read- If you aren't in school to get every penny out of your education, take someone else.  If you care about your career, take her.  You will learn more than you thought possible.  All the people that complain here aren't serious about their education - let that be the deciding factor if you take her class.

She is very tough but fair.  I submitted a paper early and asked what I should fix.  When she told me I fixed those things and resubmitted and she said it was what she was looking for.  When I got the paper back I made a low B, almost a C. You must get stuff done early and ask as may questions as possible.  GO TO CLASS.
Has high standards and expects students to be responsible. Don't take her class if you need hand-holding. Otherwise, you'll enjoy her class...and looking at her.

Absolutely AWFUL. Rubrics mean nothing, I turned in every assignment and went over every rubric. I would turn in an assignment feeling great and end up getting a 40 on it. There is no rhyme or reason to her grading. Only take this class if you have no friends, family, or outside commitments, and if you hate sleeping.

Absolutely miserable class. I did not learn nearly enough to constitute the massive workload. Dr. Goodsite is quite vague on what she wants in assignments and grades. harsh. After asking for an evaluation, 90% of the class said there was too much work. She ignored us. I would have changed majors had I taken this class earlier in my education. Awful

Ms. Goodsite is a wonderful teacher. Though a bit vague on some things in the syllabus and assignments, she will answer your questions. She knows all there is to know about education, and I really enjoyed her class. I think she prepared me well for my own classroom.

She's awesome!  Her class takes work and dedication, but you will learn a LOT!  She asks for feedback and actually cares about her student's success.  I would recommend her if you are a serious student.  If you're just in college to have fun, take someone else.

This class is very hard and time consuming.  I will say this, Mrs. Goodsite is a nice teacher.  Yes her instructions are vague and you will teach yourself so be prepared.  Do not miss more than 3 classes and stay ahead in the reading.  I appreciated her teaching style because this is the way it is in the public school system.

Mrs. Goodsite is very vague and unclear when teaching; I spent the entire semester teaching myself. She?s very hypocritical. Several times I went to her for clarification and informed one thing and the next day something different. The real sad part about all of this is she is over TOSS program; she will be the person who has your career in her han

Please don't take this professor!  She is so unorganized and when we fall behind on our schedule, she makes it seem like it is our fault.  She didn't answer our emails the weekend before our Unit Plan was due.  She assigns 15 books but you can b.s. your way through most of it because she never holds you accountable.  She wasted so much of our time!

Horrible time management skills.Doesn't appear to understand the material so she is very vague when giving directions for assignments. When students ask for directions, she gives conflicting info so you never know what to do. Everything you accomplish will be on your own. Doesn't respond to emails.  Avoid her at all costs.
